intro: Paracynoglossum, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plants typically have showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage. Paracynoglossum species are generally drought-tolerant and thrive in well-drained soil.
